column5: Anyone hear from Bcanuck?  Is he going to be there with Monty this year????  Maureen
Not real sure that Brian and Monty will make it this year.He's started a new job and may not have the time off.He has been known to show up any way though!!! Joe
You're better off just calling. When I booked they only had one 2bdr on the back of the property and the bigger cottages on the water.  -Brian
thanks Brian, I was looking for a one bedroom for the wife and I , when did you call  Tom
I spoke with Kevin last Wednesday. -Brian
....I confirmed with Kevin and Leslie bout a week back.
Cliff and I are confirmed for a campsite June 22-24.  Really looking forward to meeting everyone.   Blyght  guess that makes it 41
Yep!  Cant wait....should be a blast!
I think I speak for everyone when I say...  PLEASE LEAVE SOME WALLEYE FOR THE REST OF US!  -Brian
Okay Brian...we'll hunt Muskie 'till ya get there! LOL

LOL...we dont have a boat...so maybe no one will offer spaces to us in theres....  Then again...we've had all our success from shore, so maybe ppl will take us on a boat to get us off the docks....haha.  I'd love to hook into a Muskie actually!!!!
IAM IN! wife,2 boys and myself for the week-end maybe the week wife will see if she can get the week off --hey ccmtcanada they rent boats
Buster...thanks!  We already checked into it...so that's an option for sure.
Spawn of Ed will try to be there.   Ed is probably a gametime decision.  Either way, its an event nobody should miss.
LOL...will be good to see you again Spawn!
Looking forward to seeing you again Spawn of Ed, would be nice to see Ed again too  Maureen
Yup, it'll be good to see the pair of youz again
Yahoooooooooo  I just booked with Leslie from the 21 to th 25 cabin #8 see you all there. Me the wife and 2 others  TH
Well, I am going to be staying at my son's in Noelville that weekend but I will get out there to spend some time with the gang this year.
Big Cliff, hope to see you there

Ok.  It looks like I just about have permission to make the trip this year .... would coming alone.   Looking at pulling in Tuesday or Wednesday late afternoon and leaving Sunday.     This would be my first time at Lakair and don't know a soul (I need to fix that).  I'd like some info on planning if anyone would like to drop me a PM sometime.  1).  No camping gear - thought about getting a sleeping bag for the back of the truck.  I have a cap on it, so I'd be out of the weather.  For the campers ... how do you keep things in the cooler .... cold ?  (Buy ice when needed ?)  2).  No boat and was wondering what options I would have with teaming up with someone else or going together and renting one.  Courious how this was done in past years, as I believe there are others in the same position I am.  3).  What all we fishing for ?  I have a good selection of pike and musky baits.  Read a lot of reports about walleye fishing, but never done that.  4).  Any other tips or advice would be appreciated.  Any info would be really appreciated and I'd love to make this trip, put some faces to the posts, and maybe learn a few things ... basically self-taught to this point. Thanks to all ... in advance.  Cool - It looks like I just made 'Guide' status with this.  (Not really)  Rich
welcome Rich, I'm sure Lew or Wayne (Irishfield) or Roy can provide you with the answers to you questions as I believe they have been going since the beginning.

Rich, it'd be great if you could join us this year and guaranteed you'll have an excellent time and meet some wondeful people.  You wouldn't be the 1st or last person to sleep in your truck, and there's a great restaurant right in the camp only 100 yards away for your meals, and ice is always available for your cooler.  Kevin has excellent cedar strip boats and motors available   for rent, or you may even be able to share a boat with another OFNer who's travelling alone, which is often the case. Perhaps post a direct question here as far as sharing boats and expenses and you should be able to come up with something.  There may even be someone with an extra spot in a cabin you could share.  Pike and pickeral are very plentiful in June, but the  muskies are more difficult to find that time of year.  You definetely want to make this trip though if at all possible.
OK ..... I'm IN  !!!!!     Just confirmed with Leslie.  I told the better half that Lew and Wayne will watch over me.   That's all it took.   Thanks to both of you for your replies.
Hi Rich; I might have an extra spot in my boat for you,, Only John(bouybenson) and myself so we could make room.. boat seats 3 easly
Its official... This years Spring G2G is at Lakair again the weekend of June 23rd.  Lakair Lodge
Who would have thought! LOL Thanks for pinning it up TJ. Let the count begin.  Figure you and yours = 4 So Leah and I = 6
I have a cabin and I'll be alone =7
Amy and I are booked in for an RV site so 8 humans & 1 dog
Lew's 9 and my 2 trusty netmen, Robin & Squid, will make 11

I'm confirmed with a friend from work..   =18
I've said it once and I'll say it again... Mom raised a tall boy, not a bright one! Thanks FnS! HH

Baby Herc and I have a cottage booked.  Should arrive Wednesday or Thursday.  That's 23.
Unfortunately I will be coming up on my own this year, so if anyone has a spot in a cottage and or a boat I would be more than pleased to pay my way. Please send me a message.  Thanks, John...
I'll be there...25 and counting

I also will be there .  There will be four in our party with two boats .   NOT sure of the camp site just yet but we are booked in for JUNE 18 th till the 24 th.   ARE there any wives .      coming along for this EVENT.  THAT MAKES   (  29  )  Leaving    TO .  On  June 16 th  for HUNTSVILLE.  And heading for Lakair JUNE 18 th for the BIG EVENT. Boat should be in the water by  2.30 PM . JUST ONE THING .     HOW DO I GET THERE .     what is the best ROUTE. FROM  HUNTSVILLE    HWY # 11 OR 69. KEITH.
